newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo naphtha prices rebound, spreads shrink.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo naphtha prices rebound, spreads shrink.

text.p: Tokyo naphtha prices rebounded in late afternoon trade on Wednesday, tracking modest gains on overnight crude oil markets, while near-term spreads became narrower, traders said.
First-half February open-spec naphtha was assessed at $227.00/228.00, up $1.00 from Tuesday trade. Second-half February was sold to a Japanese trading house at $224.00.
Second-half January was quoted at $231.00/232.00, up from late Tuesday's $230.00/231.00.
In inter-month naphtha spreads, second-half January/second-half February was indicated at plus $5.00/7.00.
It switched hands at plus $7.00 between two European majors on Tuesday.
Also on Tuesday, the half-month spread from second-half January changed hands at plus $4.25 between a western trader and a Japanese trading house.
In the low sulphur waxy residue market, at least 1.2 million barrels of Indonesian cargoes are likely to be destined for Japan amid healthy demand, traders said.
Levels for December cargoes were assessed at around 60 cents over the Pertamina formula, fuel oil traders said.
